channel.title: unix on Development Cheat Sheets
channel.description: Recent content in unix on Development Cheat Sheets

item.title: awk
item.description: AWK is a domain-specific language designed for text processing and typically used as a data extraction and reporting tool.

item.title: grep
item.description: grep is a command-line utility for searching plain-text data sets for lines that match a regular expression.

item.title: inotifywait
item.description: inotifywait a linux tool that waits for changes to files using inotify

item.title: rsync
item.description: rsync is a fast, versatile, remote (and local) file-copying tool for linux.

item.title: sleep
item.description: In computing, sleep is a command in Unix, Unix-like and other operating systems that suspends program execution for a specified time.

item.title: Unix VI text editor
item.description: vi is a screen-oriented text editor originally created for the Unix operating system.
